item.title: SWIFT 和全球顶级银行正在进行基于区块链的全面改革
item.description: 全球金融报文传送网络环球银行间金融电信协会（SWIFT）和 30 多家全球银行周一宣布，他们正在 "按部就班 "地努力实现即时跨境支付，并建立一个能够处理各种新形式数字货币的系统。【原文：Global financial messaging network SWIFT and more than 30 global banks announced on Monday they were now working "at pace" on making cross-border payments instantaneous and on a system capable of handling the various new forms of digital money.】

item.title: 投资者摒弃人工智能炒作，关注政府支出带来的长期机遇
item.description: 世界上一些最大的投资者将目光投向了人工智能的蓬勃发展，而不是政府为应对未来几年将重塑市场的地缘政治、技术和人口压力而进行的长期投资。【原文：Some of the world's biggest investors are looking beyond a boom in artificial intelligence to longer-term spending by governments tackling geopolitical, technological and demographic pressures set to reshape markets over the next few years.】

item.title: 消息人士称，京东方工业集团计划在香港首次公开募股中融资 5 亿美元
item.description: 两位直接知情的消息人士称，中国在线零售商京东商城（JD.com）旗下的京东工业品（JingDong Industrials）正在寻求通过香港首次公开募股（IPO）融资 5 亿美元，最快将于 10 月底完成，此前该公司已通过了关键的监管障碍。【原文：JingDong Industrials, a unit of Chinese online retailer JD.com , is seeking to raise $500 million with a Hong Kong initial public offering (IPO) as soon as the end of October, two sources with direct knowledge said, after the firm cleared a key regulatory hurdle.】

item.title: 英国石油公司为美国海湾地区耗资 50 亿美元的 Tiber-Guadalupe 钻井项目开绿灯
item.description: 英国石油巨头英国石油公司（BP）周一表示，将在美国墨西哥湾推进一个耗资 50 亿美元、名为 Tiber-Guadalupe 的海上钻井项目，这标志着该公司重新专注于核心油气业务的战略转型又迈出了一步。【原文：British oil major BP said on Monday it will move ahead with a $5 billion offshore drilling project in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico called Tiber-Guadalupe, marking another step in the company's strategy shift to refocus on its core oil and gas business.】

item.title: 欧盟国家团结在荷兰芯片联盟周围，争取制定《芯片法 2.0
item.description: 荷兰政府周一表示，所有欧盟成员国都已加入由荷兰领导的芯片联盟，该联盟正在推动修订欧盟的《芯片法案》。【原文：All of the European Union's member states have entered a Dutch-led chips coalition that is pushing for revisions to the EU's Chips Act, the Dutch government said on Monday.】

item.title: 马来西亚航空集团宣布与 Adobe、Google、Skyscanner 和 Visa 建立数字合作伙伴关系
item.description: 马来西亚国家航空公司运营商马来西亚航空集团（Malaysia Aviation Group）周一宣布与 Adobe、谷歌、Skyscanner 和 Visa 合作提供在线旅行预订服务。【原文：Malaysia Aviation Group, the operator of national carrier Malaysia Airlines, on Monday announced a collaboration with Adobe, Google, Skyscanner and Visa for its online travel booking services.】

item.title: 法航和达美航空在史基浦机场寻求新的地勤服务合作伙伴
item.description: 荷航周一表示，法航和达美航空正在阿姆斯特丹史基浦机场寻找荷航的替代服务供应商。【原文：Air France and Delta are seeking an alternative services provider to KLM at Amsterdam Schiphol Airport, KLM said on Monday.】

item.title: Stellantis 任命 Joao Laranjo 为首席财务官
item.description: 法意汽车制造商 Stellantis 周一表示，已任命 Joao Laranjo 为首席财务官，立即生效。【原文：Franco-Italian carmaker Stellantis has appointed Joao Laranjo as chief financial officer, effective immediately, the company said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国提高 H-1B 费用，中国新 K 签证吸引外国科技人才
item.description: 中国旨在吸引外国科技人才的新签证计划将于本周启动，此举被认为有助于中国政府在与华盛顿的地缘政治竞争中占得先机，因为美国的新签证政策促使有意申请者争相寻找替代方案。【原文：China's new visa programme aimed at attracting foreign tech talent kicks off this week, a move seen boosting Beijing's fortunes in its geopolitical rivalry with Washington as a new U.S. visa policy prompts would-be applicants to scramble for alternatives.】

item.title: 道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies）将以 9.5 亿美元的价格出售北美 50%的太阳能投资组合
item.description: 道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies）周一表示，将向投资公司 KKR 出售北美地区太阳能投资组合的 50%，并称将从此次出售和银行再融资中获得 9.5 亿美元。【原文：TotalEnergies will sell 50% of a solar portfolio in North America to investment firm KKR , the energy major said on Monday, adding it will receive $950 million from the sale and bank refinancing.】

item.title: 阿斯利康转为直接在美国上市，保留在英国的上市地位
item.description: 阿斯利康公司周一表示，公司股票将直接在纽约证券交易所上市，而不是目前的存托股票，公司将继续在伦敦上市，总部设在伦敦，这是对英国投下的信任票。【原文：AstraZeneca said on Monday it would now directly list its shares on the New York Stock Exchange, instead of the current depository shares, and that it would remain listed and headquartered in London in a vote of confidence for the UK.】

item.title: 汉莎航空到 2030 年将裁员 4000 人
item.description: 德国汉莎航空公司在周一的资本市场日上表示，将通过数字化、自动化和流程整合，在2023年前裁减4000个行政工作岗位。【原文：Lufthansa will cut 4,000 administrative jobs by 20230 through digitalization, automation and process consolidation, the German airline said on Monday as part of its capital markets day.】

item.title: 需求疲软、贸易紧张，中国工厂活动可能再次放缓
item.description: 9 月份，中国的工厂活动可能连续第六个月萎缩，在美国贸易协议依然遥遥无期的情况下，世界第二大经济体要求采取更多刺激措施以抵御经济急剧放缓的呼声依然不绝于耳。【原文：China's factory activity probably shrank for a sixth straight month in September, keeping alive calls for more stimulus in the world's second-largest economy to fend off a sharp slowdown as a U.S. trade deal remains distant.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯采用低碳铝材减少电动汽车的环境足迹
item.description: 梅赛德斯-奔驰公司高管告诉路透社，利用可再生能源和回收利用生产的铝正在帮助豪华汽车制造商梅赛德斯-奔驰减少其新系列电动汽车生产过程中的二氧化碳排放量，这也是梅赛德斯-奔驰为实现运营脱碳而做出的更广泛努力的一部分。【原文：Aluminium made with renewable power and from recycling is helping luxury automaker Mercedes-Benz cut CO2 emissions in the production of its new line of electric vehicles, part of a wider effort to decarbonise operations, executives told Reuters.】

item.title: 受芯片推动和日历效应影响，韩国出口有望增长
item.description: 路透社周一的一项民意调查显示，由于技术需求强劲，韩国 9 月份的出口很可能出现增长，受日历效应影响，整体出口增长将创下 13 个月来的新高。【原文：South Korea's exports likely rose in September on strong technology demand, with headline growth seen hitting a 13-month high on calendar effects, a Reuters poll found on Monday.】

item.title: 马斯克的 X 公司表示将就印度法院有关内容删除系统的命令提起上诉
item.description: 社交媒体平台 X 周一表示，它计划对印度卡纳塔克邦的一项法院命令提出上诉，该命令将允许数百万警察通过一个名为 "Sahyog "的秘密在线门户网站发出任意删除请求。【原文：Social media platform X said on Monday it plans to appeal a court order from India’s Karnataka state, which will allow millions of police officers to issue arbitrary takedown requests via a secretive online portal called the Sahyog.】

item.title: 早间竞标到底谁需要政府？
item.description: 韦恩-科尔对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole.】

item.title: 美国需求强劲，丰田 8 月销量连续第八个月增长
item.description: 丰田汽车公司周一称，由于美国市场对其部分混合动力车型的需求持续强劲，抵消了日本市场的疲软，8月份全球销量连续第八个月增长。【原文：Toyota Motor said on Monday its global sales grew for an eighth straight month in August, as continuing strong demand for some of its hybrid models in the United States offset a weaker performance in Japan.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》称，美国证券交易委员会主席阿特金斯誓言快速废除公司季度报告
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（SEC）主席保罗-阿特金斯（Paul Atkins）周一在为《金融时报》撰写的一篇评论文章中写道，他承诺将追求最低 "剂量 "的监管，并快速推进唐纳德-特朗普总统提出的取消企业季度报告的建议，让企业可以选择每半年报告一次。【原文：U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chairman Paul Atkins pledged to pursue a minimum "dose" of regulation and fast-track President Donald Trump's proposal to scrap quarterly corporate reporting, giving companies the option to report on a semi-annual basis, he wrote in an opinion piece for the Financial Times on Monday.】

item.title: 南华早报》报道：中国比亚迪预计出口将占 2025 年销售额的 20
item.description: 据《南华早报》周一报道，中国电动汽车制造商比亚迪公司预计，在新车型推出的推动下，今年出口将占其全球销量的20%左右。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle maker BYD Co forecast exports will make up about 20% of its global sales this year helped by new model launches, the South China Morning Post reported on Monday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚电信公司 Optus 再次发生紧急电话故障
item.description: 澳大利亚电信公司 Optus 周一表示，在悉尼南部地区发生紧急电话中断事件 10 天后，又发生了更大范围的中断事件，该公司称，由于客户无法得到及时救助，可能已造成 4 人死亡。【原文：Australian telco Optus said on Monday it had suffered an emergency call outage in an area south of Sydney, 10 days after a broader disruption that it said had probably caused four deaths when customers were unable to get timely aid.】

item.title: 数据公布前美元处于守势，美国政府面临关门风险
item.description: 周一，在一系列美国经济数据公布之前，美元处于守势，这些数据可能会进一步明确美联储的利率路径，而美国政府停摆的风险日益增加也成为焦点。【原文：The dollar was on the defensive on Monday ahead of a slew of U.S. economic releases that could provide further clarity on the Federal Reserve's rate path, while the growing risk of a government shutdown there also came into sharp focus.】

item.title: 日本央行董事会的鹰派灵活性降低了 10 月加息的门槛
item.description: 日本央行在本月的政策会议上出现了鹰派董事会的分裂，这增加了其鸽派行长上田一夫加快加息步伐的压力，从而提高了下一次紧缩政策最快可能在10月份出台的前景。【原文：A hawkish board split at the Bank of Japan's policy meeting this month has increased pressure on its dovish governor Kazuo Ueda to move faster on interest rate hikes, raising the prospect the next tightening could come as soon as October.】

item.title: 美国政府面临关门风险，亚洲股市表现谨慎
item.description: 周一，亚洲股市谨慎开盘，因为投资者担心美国政府可能关门，进而推迟公布九月份的就业报告和其他一系列关键数据。【原文：Share markets got off to a cautious start in Asia on Monday as investors braced for a possible shutdown of the U.S. government, which would in turn delay publication of the September payrolls report and a raft of other key data.】

item.title: 库尔德斯坦恢复原油出口，欧佩克+计划提高产量，石油价格下跌
item.description: 伊拉克库尔德斯坦地区周末恢复了经由土耳其的原油出口，欧佩克+计划在11月再次提高石油产量，从而增加了全球供应，油价周一下滑近1%。【原文：Oil prices slipped nearly 1% on Monday after Iraq's Kurdistan region resumed crude oil exports via Turkey over the weekend and as OPEC+ plans another oil output hike in November, adding to global supplies.】

item.title: 韩国数据中心火灾后恢复部分服务
item.description: 韩国安全部长 Yun Hojung 周一表示，在一个数据中心发生火灾导致网站和数字公共设施中断后，韩国已恢复了 46 项政府服务。【原文：South Korea has restored 46 government services after a fire at a data centre disrupted websites and digital public amenities, Safety Minister Yun Hojung said on Monday.】

item.title: 工会称巴西丰田工人批准临时裁员计划
item.description: 巴西丰田汽车公司工会发表声明称，该公司位于圣保罗州的一家工厂因暴风雨受损，巴西工人周日以压倒性票数通过了临时裁员计划。【原文：Workers for Toyota in Brazil voted overwhelmingly on Sunday to approve a plan for temporary layoffs following storm damage to one of the Japanese carmaker's factories in the state of Sao Paulo, according to a statement from the workers union.】

item.title: 研究发现，匿名 TikTok 账户在捷克投票前支持激进党派
item.description: 一个非政府组织周日表示，在捷克共和国 10 月 3-4 日大选之前，视频共享平台 TikTok 上的数百个匿名账户在传播亲俄言论和支持激进政党方面日益活跃。【原文：Hundreds of anonymous accounts on video-sharing platform TikTok have been increasingly active in spreading pro-Russia narratives and backing radical parties ahead of the Czech Republic's October 3-4 election, a non-governmental group said on Sunday.】

item.title: Telegram 的杜罗夫称法国要求从应用程序中删除部分摩尔多瓦频道
item.description: Telegram 消息应用程序的亿万富翁创始人帕维尔-杜罗夫（Pavel Durov）周日指责法国情报部门通过中间人要求他在去年的总统投票前审查一些摩尔多瓦的声音，以换取在他在法国的法庭案件中提供帮助。【原文：Pavel Durov, the billionaire founder of the Telegram messaging app, accused French intelligence on Sunday of asking him through an intermediary to censor some Moldovan voices ahead of a presidential vote last year in return for help with his court case in France.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称欧佩克+计划在 11 月再次提高石油产量
item.description: 三位熟悉会谈情况的消息人士称，欧佩克+组织可能会在下周日的会议上批准再次增产石油，日产量至少增加13.7万桶，因为油价上涨促使该组织试图进一步夺回市场份额。【原文：OPEC+ will likely approve another oil production increase of at least 137,000 barrels per day at its meeting next Sunday, as rising oil prices encourage the group to try to further regain market share, three sources familiar with the talks said.】
